sentence: We had the pleasure of seeing your patient Quinten Heath today in Internal Medicine in followup for osteoporosis and hypogonadism.

sentence: As you know Mr. Heat is a pleasant 76-year-old man with a history of esophageal cancer status post surgery in 2169, chemotherapy and radiation who had back pain prompting imaging that revealed several vertebral compression fractures and his BMD was consistent with osteoporosis with a T score of minus 4.2 in the lumbar spine and minus 2.3 in the femoral neck.

sentence: started zoledronic acid IV in 05/2171 that he tolerated fine.
label: Other

sentence: In addition, we discovered primary hypogonadism with testosterone levels around 45 mg/dL and elevated FSH and LH levels.

sentence: I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Russell Urban in Cardiology Clinic today.
label: Other

sentence: As you know, Mr. Urban is a very pleasant 50-year-old gentleman who on July 09, 2093, while sitting at a concert in Central Park had the sudden onset of feeling    unwell   , epigastric discomfort, and profound diaphoresis.
label: Other

sentence: He came to the Worthington Regional Hospital Emergency Room at that time.
label: Other

sentence: By the time he arrived, his symptoms had abated.
label: Other

sentence: He had an unremarkable electrocardiogram initially and negative cardiac markers, and was admitted to the medicine service to rule-out a myocardial infarction.
label: Other

sentence: That evening, he had recurrent symptoms and was noted to have sustained wide complex tachycardia, which appears to be ventricular tachycardia.
label: Other

sentence: He was transferred to the Cardiac Care Unit for further management.
label: Other

sentence: The next morning, he underwent cardiac ultrasound, which revealed an ejection fraction of 28% and a diffusely hypokinetic left ventricle with an akinetic inferior wall.
label: Other

sentence: Additionally his next set of cardiac markers returned positive.
label: Other

sentence: He therefore went cardiac catheterization revealing a total occlusion of his right coronary artery and minimal non-obstructive disease of the left system.
label: Other

sentence: This artery was stented with total of three stents (two Express stents 2.5 x 24 mm and one Pixel stent 2.5 x 28 mm), encompassing the entire length of the right coronary artery.
label: Other

sentence: A left ventriculogram was performed and demonstrated an ejection fraction of 30% with a diffusely hypokinetic ventricle and and akinetic inferior wall.
label: Other

sentence: He ruled in for myocardial infarction with a peak CK of 1490 and a peak troponin of 2.0.
label: Other

sentence: A follow-up echocardiogram was performed on July 15, 2093.
label: Other

sentence: This study showed his ejection fraction had improved to 36%; the left ventricle was diffusely hypokinetic and the inferior wall appeared severely hypokinetic.
label: Other

sentence: His reduced ejection fraction was out of proportion to his degree of coronary disease.
label: Other

sentence: Because of this, a series of laboratory tests were performed which revealed normal iron studies, normal thyroid function, and a normal serum protein electrophoresis pattern.
label: Other

sentence: He was discharged in stable condition to follow up with me as an outpatient.
label: Other

sentence: Since his myocardial infarction, Mr. Urban has been feeling quite well.
label: Other

sentence: He has returned to work in the factory where his employed as a manufacturing manager.
label: Other

sentence: He has had no symptoms of angina, dyspnea, nausea, or diaphoresis.
label: Other

sentence: He continues to take his medications without difficulty, and denies any symptomatology whatsoever.
label: Other

sentence: His past medical history prior to this hospitalization is largely unremarkable because he had not sought medical care.
label: Other

sentence: Of note, he reports to me that about 8 or 9 years ago while living in Georgia, he presented to an emergency room with some chest discomfort.

sentence: He never had any further testing.

sentence: Dr. Nunes and I had the pleasure to see your patient, Mr. Christian Mullen, this morning in the office for a routine vascular followup.
label: Other

sentence: It has been nearly 18 months since his last visit here and in the interim time, has been having discomfort involving both of his hips, thighs, and calves.
label: Other

sentence: As you well know, Mr. Mullen is a delightful 69-year-old gentleman with history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and peripheral arterial disease who previously underwent left common femoral and left popliteal artery revascularization November 2088 followed by right external, right internal, and right common femoral artery revascularization in February 2089.
label: during DCT

sentence: Despite the technical success of both procedures, he continued to have bilateral hip claudication symptoms.
label: Other

label: Other

sentence: Unfortunately, despite these measures, he feels quite disabled and limited by his claudication symptoms.
label: Other

label: Other

sentence: Symptoms resolve with sitting and resting for approximately 2.5 minutes.

label: Other

sentence: He does not necessarily notice any change with inclines or going up stairs; in fact, he is actually able to climb 18 stairs to his office without limitation.

sentence: I had the pleasure of seeing Hannah Hendricks in Internal Medicine today.
label: Other

sentence: She was seen alongside my attending, Dr. Heidi Erik-Roy.
label: Other

sentence: As you know, she is a lovely 52-year-old female in whom you have found a left lower extremity bypass surgery.
label: Other

sentence: She comes in today for perioperative risk assessment.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has longstanding type 1 diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease.
label: during DCT

sentence: She in fact has undergone lower extremity bypass grafting in both her left and right lower extremities.
label: Other

sentence: Specifically, she is status post a right fem-pop bypass in 2066 and a left fem-DP bypass also in 2066.
label: Other

sentence: It appears that her right graft has been functioning well, but her left graft was noted to be occluded many years ago.
label: Other

sentence: She comes in now with a nonhealing ulcer and gangrene in her left toe.
label: Other

sentence: You have planned a redo bypass for this upcoming Saturday.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has never had any history of coronary artery disease.
label: Other

sentence: She has never had any chest discomfort, shortness of breath, orthopnea, PND, lower extremity edema, palpitations, lightheadedness, or syncope.
label: Other

sentence: She does have a strong family history of coronary artery disease with a brother who had several myocardial infarctions and died at the age of 48 of an MI.
label: Other

sentence: She has a report of a prior EKG with suggestion of an old anteroseptal MI.
label: Other

sentence: She has never had any evaluation for underlying coronary artery disease nor has she had any symptoms referable to CAD.
label: Other

sentence: In terms of her functional capacity, she tells me that up until a year ago, she was doing spinning classes without any chest discomfort or shortness of breath whatsoever.
label: Other

sentence: Because of increasing discomfort in her left lower extremity, she had to reduce her exercise and of late has only been able to do weightlifting without aerobic exercise.
label: Other

sentence: She is however able to climb stairs in her home without any discomfort in her chest or any shortness of breath.
label: Other

sentence: She is unfortunately limited significantly by foot pain.
label: Other

sentence: Her past medical history is as noted above including type 1 diabetes for which she uses an insulin pump, peripheral arterial disease, status post bilateral lower extremity bypass, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia.
label: during DCT

sentence: Her current medications include aspirin 325 mg, which she started a few days ago, Lipitor 10 mg once daily, Diovan 160 mg twice daily, vitamin C, vitamin B and folic acid supplementation.
label: Other

sentence: She has no clear drug allergies, but does get nauseous and vomiting with Percocet.
label: Other

sentence: She is a past smoker and had smoked for approximately three years, one pack per day in her early 20s.
label: Other

sentence: She works as a Senior Manager of Broadcasting at giant food in Albemarle.
label: Other

sentence: As I mentioned previously, her family history is notable for a brother who died of an MI in his late 40s.
label: Other

sentence: On physical examination, her blood pressure is 135/79, heart rate is 97 and her weight is 137 pounds.
label: Other

sentence: In general, she is very well appearing and in no apparent distress at rest.
label: Other

sentence: She has a jugular venous pressure of approximately 5 cm of water.
label: Other

sentence: She has 2+ carotids with no audible bruits.
label: Other

sentence: Her upper extremities demonstrate 2+ brachial and radial pulses bilaterally.
label: Other

sentence: Her chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
label: Other

sentence: Her cardiac exam reveals a regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2, and a soft 2/6 systolic ejection murmur best heard at the left sternal border.
label: Other

sentence: She has no abdominal bruits and no significantly palpable aorta.
label: Other

sentence: Her lower extremity exam is notable for a hyperemic left foot with a bandage, which is covering what is reportedly a gangrenous toe.
label: Other

sentence: Her left lower extremity pulses are 1+ in the femoral, absent popliteal and absent distal pulses.
label: Other

sentence: In her right lower extremity, she has 1+ femoral, with no bruit, 2+ popliteal, 2+ DP and 1+ PT.
label: Other

sentence: An EKG done in our clinic today demonstrates a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 97 beats per minute with a left axis deviation.
label: Other

sentence: There is left atrial enlargement and Q-waves in V1 through V3 suggestive of an old anteroseptal MI.
label: Other

sentence: There are also Q-waves in lead III and aVF, which raises suspicion of an old inferior MI.
label: Other

sentence: In summary, Ms. Hendricks is a lovely 52-year-old female with longstanding diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease who comes in today for perioperative risk assessment in light of an anticipated redo left lower extremity bypass graft.
label: during DCT

sentence: She appears to have an excellent functional capacity up until several months ago.
label: Other

sentence: However, I am concerned by her electrocardiogram, which raises the suspicion of underlying coronary artery disease given the findings of a probable inferior and old anteroseptal myocardial infarction.
label: Other

sentence: As such, I think that it would be wise to better delineate her burden of coronary artery disease by way of a stress test prior to her surgery.
label: Other

sentence: Given that her functional status has been so good up until recently, I do not think that we need to delay her surgery.
label: Other

sentence: However, I would start her on a beta-blocker and as such, I have given her a prescription for atenolol 25 mg once daily, which she will start today and continue up to and beyond the perioperative period.
label: Other

sentence: During the perioperative period, we would recommend that she has tight control of her blood pressure and heart rate with a goal blood pressure less than 120/80 and a goal heart rate less than 60.
label: Other

sentence: I would also make sure to obtain a postoperative EKG to ensure there has not been any changes.
label: Other

sentence: We will try to arrange for an exercise test with arm ergometry and MIBI imaging for tomorrow morning.
label: Other

sentence: If we are unable to do arm exercise, we will obtain an adenosine MIBI.
label: Other

sentence: I will follow up with the results tomorrow after the study is performed.
label: Other

sentence: As I mentioned because her functional capacity is good, I do not anticipate that we will need to make any changes in the surgical scheduling based on the test results.
label: Other

sentence: This is more in order to give us a sense of the underlying burden of coronary artery disease.
label: Other

sentence: It was a pleasure seeing Ms. Hendricks in clinic today.
label: Other

sentence: We are certainly available during the perioperative period if any cardiovascular issues are to arise.
label: Other

sentence: Please feel free to contact me with any questions.
label: Other

sentence: HPI: 73 yo black woman with h/o HTN and recurrent non-malignant axillary lymphadenopathy, newly diagnosed with HOCM in the setting of fatigue, weight loss and hypercalcemia concerning for sarcoidosis during a work-up at her last admission to MEDIQUIK on 6/2-6/20/97.
label: after DCT

sentence: At that time, the patient noted that 3-4 mo PTA she had experienced worsening fatigue and dry mouth, as well as poor oral intake with associated 30 lb weight loss.
label: Other

sentence: In early May, she presented to the walk-in clinic with these complaints and a CXR showed increased interstitial markings and mediastinal lymphadenopathy subsequently confirmed by CT. A PET CT showed FDG avidity in multiple enlarged thoracic and axillary nodes.
label: Other

sentence: The patient was seen at the lymphoma center by Dr. Utter, and concern was raised for multiple processes including sarcoid, lupus-like syndromes, Castleman's, and indolent lymphoma.
label: Other

sentence: Labs drawn at different times in recent past were notable for a Ca of 11.8 with Alb of 3.5, a mild tranaminitis in the 40s, LDH of 354, ACE of 68, normal TSH, HCT of 30.2, ESR of 85, SPEP with diffuse gamma globulin increase, positive ANA at 1:2560 with nuclear pore staining (highly specific for biliary cirrhosis), elevated B2MG at 17.5, and elevated kappa and lambda free light chains at 66 and 83.5, respectively and negative HIV.
label: Other

sentence: The patient   s hypercalcemia was treated with IVF, lasix at times, and a dose of bisphosphonate, which led to a decrease in Ca to 10.1.
label: Other

sentence: Axillary lymph node biopsy 6/08/97 revealed non-specific follicular hyperplasia, though to be consistent with a reactive process.
label: Other

sentence: Oncology was consulted, and a lymphoma work-up was pursued; flow cytometry revealed polyclonal CD19+ B cells, CD4+ and CD8+ T cells, with no evidence for a monoclonal B or unusual T cell population.
label: Other

sentence: Repeat CT examination of the chest revealed no change in the bilateral axillary, mediastinal, and hilar lymphadenopathy and offered no further clues to diagnostic possibilities.
label: Other

sentence: The patient underwent pulmonary function testing, which showed a reduction in the FEV1, FVC, and FEV1/FVC ratio; total lung capacity and subdivisions were normal, resistance and specific conductance were normal, and single breath diffusion capacity was reduced.
label: Other

sentence: On 7/19/97, a bronchoscopy was attempted, but the patient was unable to tolerate the procedure, and it was not performed.
label: Other

sentence: Thoracic surgery was consulted and recommended that the patient be evaluated in the outpatient setting for biopsy under general anesthesia.
label: Other

sentence: Fungal antibodies were sent, and a trial of steroids was not attempted during hospitalization.
label: Other

label: Other

sentence: She reports significant acid reflux, saying    only water goes down    and a lack of appetite with very dry mouth.

sentence: She further denies N/V, diarrhea, fever/chills/dizziness or recent infection.
label: Other

sentence: Of note, she has been drinking little, but urinating 9-10 times a day, clear urine with large volumes.
label: Other

sentence: She has not had a bowel movement for several days.
label: Other

sentence: She has continued her medications as instructed at the time of discharge.

sentence: Thank you for allowing me to share in the medical care of Ms. Norma Mckee, a 51-year-old female patient with the history of seizure disorder, hypertension, borderline diabetes, gastroesophageal reflux disease and panic related symptoms, and depressive disorder, who complains of excessive daytime sleepiness with recent polysomnographic abnormalities.
label: during DCT

sentence: HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  As you already know, Ms. Mckee describes a longstanding history of snoring symptomatology and suspected nocturnal respiratory pauses, and describes a "restless sleep", but only relatively recently (over the last five months, particularly after 12/26 of last year).
label: Other

sentence: She has described marked increased daytime sleepiness.
label: Other

sentence: She essentially describes a nocturnal sleep pattern which involves "sleeping around the clock" during which time she may initiate sleep between 12:30 and 1:00 a.m., and after a couple awakenings, will wake up at 10:00 a.m., only to demonstrate frequent and often prolonged daytime naps of four hours duration.
label: Other

sentence: The patient states she will waken for a couple of hours and then reinitiate sleep for an additional four hours.
label: Other

sentence: She states that she is so tired that she can "fall asleep right after breakfast".
label: Other

sentence: She then would get up for lunch and then go right back to sleep and sustain sleep until 3:00 p.m.  in the afternoon.
label: Other

sentence: Ms. Mckee also demonstrates a history of seizures initiated at 3 to 4 years of age, and was initially started on phenobarbital therapy.
label: Other

sentence: She later switched to Dilantin therapy, but more recently and particularly since the mid 10's, she has been on Tegretol antiepileptic monotherapy 200 mg tablets, four tablets po q.a.m.
label: Other

sentence: While Ms. Mckee also demonstrates both daytime and nocturnal seizures, there has been increased predilections for nocturnal seizures over the last year, and an increased amount of "diffuse" spike wave discharges are evident during light sleep, as detailed during a recent polysomnographic evaluation (please see below).
label: Other

sentence: CURRENT MEDICATIONS:  Remeron, Celexa, Zestril, Prilosec, carbamazepine (200 mg tablets, four tablets in the morning and three tablets at night), clonazepam, hydrochlorothiazide, Premarin, tetracycline and klor-con.
label: Other

sentence: ALLERGIES:  No adverse drug allergies reported.
label: Other

sentence: SLEEP HISTORY:  Sleep onset intended for 11:00 p.m. but the patient does not often sleep until 12:30 to 1:00 a.m.  She describes one to two early morning awakenings, with relative ease with regards to subsequent reinitiation and maintenance.
label: Other

sentence: Sleep offset initially occurs at 8:30 to 9:00 a.m. and sometimes as late as 10:00 a.m.
label: Other

sentence: The patient will then get up and right after breakfast fall asleep for several hours in duration (up to four hours).
label: Other

sentence: The patient then will reawaken and have lunch and then after a couple of hours of sustained wakefulness, will reinitiate sleep for an additional four hours of sleep.
label: Other

sentence: Patient may sleep until 3:00 p.m. on certain given afternoons.
label: Other

sentence: The patient describes a history of prominent snoring symptomatology and suspected nocturnal respiratory pauses as well as "restless" sleep.
label: Other

sentence: She denies a history of restless lower limb sensory complaints of nocturnal lower limb movements suggestive of periodic limb movement disorder.
label: Other

sentence: She denies the history of abnormal arousal behaviors or associated narcoleptic symptoms.
label: Other

sentence: SOCIAL HISTORY:  Patient denies active tobacco use.
label: Other

sentence: She has discontinued all alcoholic beverage intake due to her reflux disease.
label: Other

sentence: She averages two cups of tea per day.
label: Other

sentence: While describing an overweight status, she has increased her weight by 10-20 pounds over the past four years.
label: Other

sentence: PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:  On examination, the patient demonstrates a mildly hypersomnolent facies.
label: Other

sentence: No obvious cranial nerve deficits are appreciated.
label: Other

sentence: No focal sensory motor neurologic deficits are noted.
label: Other

sentence: No significant appendicular dystaxias or dysmetrias are currently in evidence.
label: Other

sentence: The routine gait appears to be normal based, without evidence of significant gait dystaxias.
label: Other

sentence: No current clinical ictal manifestations are present.
label: Other

sentence: No acute evidence of "microsleeps" are noted.
label: Other

sentence: On HEENT examination, there is evidence of a small posterior oropharyngeal apeture, with increased redundant tissue evident posteriorly and a mildly elongated uvula, as well as a high riding base of the tongue and mildly increased tonsillar size.
label: Other

sentence: Vital signs include a blood pressure of 144/88 (seated, left arm) and a heart rate of 88, with a respiratory rate of 14.
label: during DCT

sentence: Hypersomnia (780.54):  Likely to be a result of frequent sleep disordered breathing events and their associated arousals.
label: Other

sentence: Other diagnostic possibilities include the presence of gastroesophageal reflux associated arousals as well as nocturnal sleep disruptions due to sleep related epilepsy (although seizures appear to be under relatively good control on Tegretol anticonvulsant monotherapy).
label: Other

sentence: Obstructive sleep disordered breathing (780.53):  Patient describes a history of prominent snoring symptomatology and nocturnal respiratory pauses as well as extremely frequent intermittent obstructive apneas and a respiratory disturbance index of 26 per hour as noted during a recent 3/26/27 sleep study with associated O2 desaturations down to 76 percent.
label: Other

sentence: Good clinical response to nocturnal CPAP therapy noted.
label: Other

sentence: Seizure disorder:  Recent literature suggests that there is a possible association between treatment of obstructive sleep disorder and increased seizure frequency in patients who are susceptible; i.e., thereby giving a further impetus for regular ongoing home CPAP therapy.
label: Other

sentence: Suggest regular home CPAP administration (CPAP Mallinckrodt; Respironics "contour classic" mask; ramp time of 20 minutes; warm air humidification; at 12 cm of water pressure).
label: Other

sentence: Pending clinical response, will reassess the patient's level of alertness, decrease amount of early morning awakenings, and possibly decrease seizure frequency at the next sleep study evaluation in 12-14 weeks times.
label: Other

sentence: In addition, patient is advised to continue efforts at weight reduction, use of an oro-dental, and/or potential ENT surgical approaches may also help to improve upper airway signs and symptoms.
label: Other

sentence: Patient to continue on Tegretol anticonvulsant monotherapy 200 mg tablets, four tablets po q.a.m.
label: Other

sentence: until an assessment of seizure frequency with nocturnal CPAP therapy has been made.
label: Other

sentence: Follow up neurologic reevaluation in our sleep study department is tentatively scheduled in 12-14 weeks time.
label: Other

sentence: Once again, thank you for allowing me to share in the medical care of Ms. Norma Mckee.

sentence: I hope this letter finds you in the best of health.

sentence: Extremely frequent intermittent obstructive (82) and partially obstructive apneas (63) during supine sleep, as well as intermittent hypopneas (19) and nocturnal hypoventilations, intermittent snore arousals (4) and episodes of moderate snoring (respiratory disturbance index = 26 per hour) with associated arousals and O2 desaturations down to 76%.
